conclusion: Determine the farthest vertical distance from the wellhead water surface for a panoramic view using optics principles.
Depth of the well is 8 m, radius of the wellhead is 0.5 m, refractive index of water is 4/3.
Calculate the critical angle using Snell's Law: sin(θc) = 1/n, θc ≈ 48.6°.
Frog is at the bottom of the well and wants to see all scenery outside through the water surface.
Light rays from the frog refract at the water-air interface at the critical angle.
Use trigonometry to find the farthest vertical distance: h = r/tan(θc), h ≈ 0.44 m.
Total vertical distance from the wellhead is the sum of the well depth and calculated height: 8.44 m.
The farthest vertical distance from the wellhead water surface is approximately 0.44 m.
